We stayed in the queen room and used the second room to organize our belongings. The queen bed was so cozy we slept in every day. The breakfasts were substantial and prepared with care; the kitchen is large enough and has enough utensils and tools for guess to use to prepare meals and there is enough seating to accommodate a guest or two‚Äî a huge bonus for us since we were visiting family in Juneau. We really appreciated all of the thoughtful details in the apartment. A treasure!

I can't say enough about this gracious couple and their beautiful space.
Juneau would've still been gorgeous without them, but staying with them turned it into more than just a touristy vacation. I came away feeling the roots and power of the people and the land.
Pua and Len both shared an invaluable wealth of information on the Tlingit people, as well as suggestions for things to do and local happenings. I ended up dancing in the street with them and local Juneau-ites in 40 degree weather at an end of the season jam, as well as being invited to their table for delicious deer meat stew. And while I'm on the subject of food, Pua made breakfast and brought it down every morning. Have you ever had a scone so good you want to cry??? You might if you stay here :-)
They gauged perfectly when I wanted to engage and when I didn't, which is really an art form with people you've just met. The ease of communication made my week stay very easy. They checked in early about logistics like making sure I was warm enough and encouraging me to use the washing machine if I needed it (a huge help when a regular hike turns into a mud hike).
The sheets, towels, and pillows were all quite comfortable, and having a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker really helped me keep the overall cost of my trip down. If that wasn't enough to entice you, you get to be surrounded by many of Pua's sumptuous paintings. It really helps prepare your minds eye to see Juneau, not just to look at it.
So, in conclusion, these two are the best (and when their little dog Princess gets comfy with you she will let you rub the belly). I was sad to leave, and am already planning my return. So, book with them now, or else I will take your spot ;-)
Puanani's apartment is clean and filled with amazing artwork. It was like living in a gallery. Thank you.
A cozy artist retreat and it looked and felt like I was experiencing living in Juneau full time. The home was warm and inviting. Everything we needed in our "home away from home."

I was born and raised in Juneau and I often return to visit family and friends annually. Puanani's thoughtfulness shined throughout our visit, She made my sweetheart feel at home and although Juneau will always be home for me, it's people like she and Leonard that epitomize what Juneau is all about. They make a Juneau kid proud to be a Juneau kid. Stay with Puanani and Leonard and you won't regret it! Also, those homemade strawberry rhubarb scones!!! WOW!
Great location, easy walk to downtown Juneau. Warm welcome from Puanani and Leonard and delicious breakfasts delivered to your table each morning. Great value!

Puanani's place is a wonderful base from which to visit Juneau and the environs. Close to the downtown, near the bus line, and major hiking trials near downtown. It is a lovely and comfortable space with all the things a visitor needs with many thoughtful personal touches, which make it feel like staying in a home where someone put thought into the comfort of visitors. It is also a real treat to spend mornings and evenings surrounded by Puanani's wonderful
paintings. Puanani was most helpful in providing an introduction to Juneau, where and how to find things and suggestions on things to do. She was great at being available for questions, but giving a visitor space and privacy. She and Leonard provided a wonderful welcome to Juneau and Alaska. I am most grateful.

Pua and Leonard were excellent hosts and really made our stay in Juneau much more enjoyable. Their suggestions for places to eat and things to do/see were spot on. They were also very helpful with transportation logistics and provided a lots of food for breakfast and snacks. Thanks again!

Staying with Puanani and Leonard was just like staying at home. The apartment was so cozy, home like, and well taken care of. We were greeted off the bat with a full binder of local attractions and restaurants and things to do and a fridge full of amenities. The entire week felt like staying with family over anything and I could not have asked for a better experience. Next time I‚Äôm back in town, I know exactly where I‚Äôm staying. Thanks again Pua and Leonard!

It is great place that is very well located and with lots of space. We were lucky to have sunny days! But it is big enough to hang out if the weather gets too bad. We slept very well on the big bed. Some noises from upstairs as in previous comments but very few and did not bother us. We lived our stay in Juneau, definitely recommend this place. Thanks Leonard and Puanani!
Absolutely loved my stay! Everything was perfect and I felt right at home. Will definitely be coming back!

Puanani and Leonard are kind and generous hosts. The private downstairs apartment is extremely comfortable and covered in beautiful artwork. The small kitchen has a small fridge and tea/coffee makings and is lightly stocked. The location is in a lovely part of town, an easy walk to downtown and to hiking trails. Our taxi driver said that the neighborhood homes are old mining houses. This is a wonderful stay and a great value.

Great spot, easy walk from downtown. The basement flat is brightened up with lots of bright paintings. Puanani and Leonard were great hosts making sure everything was easy for us and even supplying some freshly caught salmon for our first evening meal! Many thanks had a great time!

We loved our hosts. They were very accommodating. This apartment has enough space that you don't feel crowded. However, if someone has a mobility problem, this space would not be for them. Our hosts have taken the basement of their home and made a two bedroom apartment. Therefore to get to the space, you have to go down a small staircase. If yo have any walking problems, you might have difficulty with thus. The apartment has its own entrance. This enables tbe guests to have more privacy.

Puanani and Leonard were absolutely wonderful hosts! They went above and beyond with communication, offers to help with anything we needed, and personal touches... including homemade breakfast deliveries! It was a very welcome surprise. The apartment is beautiful, decorated with Pua's amazing artwork, and the beds are very comfortable. We loved everything about our stay!

WOW!
This was our first airbnb experience and Pua and Leonard went Above & Beyond in our opinion! They treated us like family or treasured friends, not complete strangers.
Not only did she meet us at the ferry (which arrived 45 minutes late that night!), but she allowed me to ship a box of gluten-free items to her home (then she had located some FABULOUS GF pretzels which were in our Welcome Basket), as well as receieving another box I shipped with a gift I needed for our next vacation stop, then she and Leonard even offered us the use of their vehicles! (when they didn't need them) Unheard of!! Plus, gave us free tickets to go on the Tram (although we didn't have time). They also took us to our scheduled boat trip, which departed at 7:00 a.m. on Sunday morning, then gave us a ride to the airport on the day we departed! Really exceptional, in our opinion. You couldn't ask for nicer or more accommodating hosts!!
The cozy basement rooms were very comfortable and bright, due in large part to all of the amazing artwork (most of which is Pua's!), and the bed is AWESOME! At least as comfortable as ours at home!!
The only things to note before booking:
- there is no tv in the space, so anyone who has a high tv need should consider that. We were busy being tourists and/or relaxing, so my husband only noticed this and "missed" his news fix on our last day there.
- Also, pay attention to how the hot water in the shower works! The water is very hot, so younger children, even tweens, should be assisted so they aren't scalded.
Aside from those small considerations, you can't go wrong booking with Pua and Leonard. They will make your stay in Juneau very memorable!
Puanani is very friendly and accommodating with any plans you may have! Super convenient location. Hands down the best Air BnB I've ever stayed at.

This is a funky place. But for the low price it's good. The beds are comfortable, kitchen is great ,all the amenities. It is a basement dwelling so not a lot of light.
Be aware you will hear the noise from feet and voices upstairs, above you. They are very nice folks, so it's a great place to stay if you just use it for sleeping and it's location. Though you will be woken early by their upstairs noise!

Pua and Leonard are wonderful hosts, going above and beyond to take care of us . We made new friends in Alaska! The accommodations were perfect as well. Just a short walk to town and all of the tourist attractions. It was clean, well stocked with everything we needed. We loved looking at Pua's beautiful artwork that decorates the walls.
Thank you so much Pua and Leonard for everything

Pua and her husband Leonard were the most wonderful and friendly hosts and we were just floored by their generosity and kindness. The rental was spacious, clean, and well stocked with any thing we might have needed during our stay. The rooms and living area is decorated with many of Pua's amazing art and they made sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed to enjoy our stay. The location is convenient, about a 10 minute walk to downtown and the cruise ships and only a few minutes from the local grocery store. Highly recommended and we can't wait to go back to visit!

Pua and Leonard were amazing hosts and went above and beyond to make us feel truly welcome. The residential neighborhood is very cute and a close walk to both downtown and the Mt. Roberts Trail, which has fantastic views of Juneau. Pua was nice enough to pick us up at the local ferry terminal building, which was great because it was a bit out of town. The basement apartment was huge! We had access to 2 bedrooms, a bathroom, and a large kitchen. Plus it's connected to Pua's studio, so all her amazing paintings are on display. The parfaits and breakfast food in the morning were great, plus they invited us up one morning for Leonard's world famous pancakes. Totally unexpected and extremely generous! We got to experience regular Juneau life, since all the neighbors say hi and a few stopped by to visit. We also had no idea that we would be in the presence of "Tlingit Elvis", and it was fun to see Leonard in newspaper articles and books, as well as see the costume that Pua had hand-sewed for Leonard. Overall, Pua and Leonard are great hosts and we hope to be able to visit them again in the future!

We had such a wonderful stay in Juneau! We were in town for the wedding of good friends, but built in some extra time to enjoy the area. Puanani and Leonard were excellent hosts. They were respectful of our privacy but also so warm and welcoming. They made it clear that they were there for us as much as we needed them to be. Communication was prompt and helpful, too. Puanani was even kind enough to drive us from/to the airport, which was really going above and beyond for a host! Greatly appreciated.
"An artist's home away from home" is the perfect description of the space. It's clean, cozy, and full of lots of colorful artwork and thoughtful touches, like the breakfast parfait (delicious) and snacks delivered to our little fridge, and the variety of teas and coffee-fixin's on the countertop. The bed was plush and comfortable. The shower is hot (!) with excellent water pressure. We felt very comfortable and very much at home.
Be aware that this is an apartment in the basement level of the house - Puanani and Leonard live upstairs and you will hear them moving around. This didn't bother us at all, but just a note to travelers unaccustomed to apartment living.
The location is fantastic - in a quiet residential part of Juneau that we hadn't explored before. A comfortable walk to downtown, and a stone's throw from two of the highlights of our trip: Cope Park (gorgeous morning hike along the Gold Creek trail) and Coppa, home of life-changing handmade ice cream.
This would be a perfect spot for a small family or group, since there's plenty of room, but it was also a great place for our just-the-two-of-us getaway. We look forward to returning!
Great spot, extremely easy walking distance from the airport. A beautifully decorated, luxurious, fun stay!

My 4 friends and I got in late from a ferry ride, and we appreciated having a place to stay within walking distance to the airport. I wish we could have stayed longer because it was very comfortable and nice! We were extremely grateful for the snacks, and the coffee bar was a nice touch. Perfect space for friends or family!
Clean elegant place
Very nice accommodation and good value Host has planned well for guest needs. Will use again on next trip to visit son and granddaughter.

Laura could not have been more helpful. The walk to the beach memorable.
The place immaculate and functional
